attributes.action: Crash for Cash Fraudsters MUST Pay Back Money. Lower Premiums For Honest Drivers.
attributes.additional_details:
Car Insurance companies should take money from fraudsters who stage fake accidents 'crash for cash'. A 'crash for cash' scam costs every driver £90 in insurance premiums.

So many people pay more for their car insurance. I'm a university student and my insurance on 1.2 cars is over £2,500 and £2,800+ on 1.4 cars.

In 2013, there was an 18% rise in insurance fraud on false whiplash claims that cost a record £1.3billion.

Fake Accidents Cost Drivers £400m Every Year:
http://www.confused.com/car-insurance/articles/fake-accidents-cost-drivers-400m-a-year

We want the government to take action. Arrest the fraudsters and ask them to pay back all the money. Also, bring down insurance premiums for honest drivers.
